CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 24, 1954, pg. 11, reads: "Alpha Picnic - As usual the Alpha picnic attracted a large crowd of fun-lovers who responded to the clever invitations sent out by the members of the fraternity, by taking them up on their invite to spend a day with Robin Hood in Sherwood's Forest. in photos on the left and right are members of the committee, dressed in authentic costumes of Robin Hood's era...Other costumed Alphas who served on the committee were Dr. McKinley King, Frank Enty, Dr. Ernest Wesley and Harry Thornton. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity members McKinley King, Frank Enty, Ernest Wesley, and Harry Thornton wearing Robin Hood costumes for Alpha picnic, North Park
